name: The Danaides
description: forty-nine daughters of Danaus who murdered their husbands and were condemned to an eternity of carrying water in leaky jugs

name: Ixion
description: a king of the Lapiths who attempted to rape Hera and was bound to a flaming wheel in Tartarus

name: Sisyphus
description: a king of Thessaly who attempted to cheat death and was sentenced to an eternity of rolling a boulder up a hill, only to watch it roll back down

name: Tantalus
description: a king of Anatolia who butchered his son Pelops and served him as a meal to the gods; he was punished with the torment of starvation, food and drink eternally dangling just out of reach
